senses.definition: a tree with yellow or white flowers. There are several types of acacia tree, some of which produce a sticky liquid used in making glue.
the small brown nut of the oak tree, that grows in a base that is like a cup acre
very simple plants, such as seaweed, that have no real leaves, stems or roots, and that grow in or near water algae
a tropical plant with thick leaves that have sharp points and that contain a lot of water. The juice of some types of aloe is used in medicine and cosmetics.
a book, especially one for children, that is published once a year, with the same title each time, but different contents

examples.x: The children usually asked for comic or sporting annuals for Christmas.

senses.definition: any plant that grows and dies within one year or season
the grey or black powder that is left after something, especially tobacco, wood or coal, has burnt

examples.x: cigarette ash
black volcanic ash
Ash from the volcano fell over a wide area.
She flicked ash out of the window carelessly.

senses.definition: what is left after something has been destroyed by burning

examples.x: The town was reduced to ashes in the fighting.
the glowing ashes of the campfire
The fire had died to cold ashes.
The party had risen, like a phoenix, from the ashes of electoral disaster.
She had seen all her dreams turn to ashes.

senses.definition: the powder that is left after a dead person’s body has been cremated (= burned)

examples.x: She wanted her ashes to be scattered at sea.

senses.definition: a forest tree with grey bark
the hard pale wood of the ash tree
the letter æ, used in Old English, and as a phonetic symbol to represent the vowel sound in cat
a type of poplar tree, with leaves that move even when there is very little wind -en
a tall plant that is a member of the grass family and has hard hollow stems that are used for making furniture, poles, etc. Bamboo

examples.x: a bamboo grove
a bamboo chair
bamboo shoots (= young bamboo plants that can be eaten)

senses.definition: a South Asian tree with structures that grow down from the branches to the ground and then grow into new roots and trunks
a short thick tree, found especially in Africa and Australia, that lives for many years
the outer layer of a tree

examples.x: The bark peels off in summer.

senses.definition: the short loud sound made by dogs and some other animals

examples.x: The dog gave a loud bark.

senses.definition: a short loud sound made by a gun or a voice

examples.x: a bark of laughter

senses.definition: a tall forest tree with smooth grey bark, shiny leaves and small nuts

examples.x: forests planted with beech
beech hedges

senses.definition: the wood of the beech tree
a very poisonous plant with purple flowers and black berries
a poisonous drug made from deadly nightshade
any plant that lives for two years, producing flowers in the second year -al
a tree with smooth bark and thin branches that grows in northern countries
the hard pale wood of the birch tree
the practice of hitting somebody with a bunch of birch sticks, as a punishment
a type of North American cherry tree

examples.x: Wild black cherry trees are native to Central Kentucky.

senses.definition: the sour (= not sweet) black fruit of the black cherry tree

senses.definition: the valuable hard wood of the black cherry tree

examples.x: This salad bowl is made of black cherry.

senses.definition: the flat part of a knife, tool or machine, which has a sharp edge or edges for cutting

senses.definition: one of the flat parts that turn around in an engine or on a helicopter

rotor blades on a helicopter

senses.definition: the flat wide part of an oar (= one of the long straight pieces of wood that are used to row a boat) that goes in the water
a single flat leaf of grass

examples.x: Not a blade of grass stirred.

senses.definition: the flat metal part on the bottom of an ice skate
a flower (usually one on a plant that people admire for its flowers)

examples.x: the exotic blooms of the orchid

senses.definition: a healthy fresh appearance

examples.x: the bloom in her cheeks
the bloom of youth

senses.definition: to produce flowers

examples.x: Most roses will begin to bloom from late May.

senses.definition: to become healthy, happy or confident

examples.x: The children had bloomed during their stay on the farm.

senses.definition: a flower or a mass of flowers, especially on a fruit tree or bush bloom

senses.definition: to produce blossom

examples.x: The cherry trees blossomed early this year.

senses.definition: to become more healthy, confident or successful

examples.x: She has visibly blossomed over the last few months.

senses.definition: a tropical climbing plant with red, purple, white or pink flowers
a large branch of a tree bow
a bunch of flowers arranged in an attractive way so that it can be carried in a ceremony or presented as a gift

a bridal/wedding bouquet

senses.definition: the pleasant smell of a type of food or drink, especially of wine

senses.definition: a wild plant with large leaves that grows thickly on hills and in woods and turns brown in the autumn
a wild bush with thorns on which blackberries grow
a small soft black fruit that grows on a bush with thorns in gardens or in the countryside. The bush is also called a blackberry.
a part of a tree that grows out from the main stem and on which leaves, flowers and fruit grow

examples.x: She climbed the tree and hid in the branches.
the bare branches of a tree in winter

senses.definition: a local office or shop belonging to a large company or organization

senses.definition: a division of an area of knowledge or a group of languages

senses.definition: a smaller or less important part of a river, road, railway, etc. that leads away from the main part

senses.definition: a group of members of a family who all have the same ancestors

a plant that grows in hot dry regions, especially one with thick stems covered in spines but without leaves. There are many different types of cactus.
the ring of small green leaves (called sepals) that protect a flower before it opens

a white, pink, red or yellow flower, often worn as a decoration on formal occasions

a plant that grows along the ground, up walls, etc., often winding itself around other plants
a small yellow, purple or white flower that appears in early spring

to cross the road/street
to cross the sea/mountains

More than 150 000 people crossed the bridge that day.

senses.definition: to pass across each other

examples.x: The roads cross just outside the town.
The straps cross over at the back and are tied at the waist.
Our letters must have crossed in the mail (= each was sent before the other was received).

senses.definition: to put or place something across or over something else

examples.x: to cross your arms/legs (= place one arm or leg over the other)

a flag with a design of two crossed keys

senses.definition: to oppose somebody or speak against them or their plans or wishes

examples.x: She's really nice until you cross her.

senses.definition: to make two different types of animal breed (= produce young) together; to mix two types of plant to form a new one

senses.definition: to kick or pass a ball to the side across the field

examples.x: Sissoko crossed from the left.

senses.definition: to draw a line across something

senses.definition: to make the sign of the cross (= the Christian symbol) on your chest
a mark or an object formed by two lines crossing each other (X or +); the mark (X) is often used on paper to show something

Put a cross beside the name of the candidate you wish to vote for.

senses.definition: a long straight piece of wood with one end in the ground and a shorter piece joined across it from side to side near the top. In ancient times people were hung on crosses and left to die as a punishment.
the cross that Jesus Christ died on, used as a symbol of Christianity

examples.x: The priest blessed her, and made the sign of the cross over her.

senses.definition: a plant with leaves that are sensitive to touch and light

senses.definition: a large amount of money

senses.definition: a very small green or yellow plant without flowers that spreads over wet surfaces, rocks, trees, etc.

senses.definition: a small tree that has red berries in the autumn

examples.x: The Queen laid a wreath at the war memorial.

senses.definition: an arrangement of flowers and/or leaves in the shape of a circle, traditionally hung on doors as a decoration at Christmas

examples.x: a holly wreath

senses.definition: a circle of flowers or leaves worn on the head, and used in the past as a sign of honour

examples.x: a laurel wreath

senses.definition: a circle of smoke, cloud, etc.

examples.x: wreaths of mist

senses.definition: a small tree with dark green leaves and small red berries
the wood of the yew tree
a round yellow-orange citrus fruit with a sharp taste, used in cooking or in drinks

examples.x: The yuzu is too acidic to be eaten raw, but its distinctive fragrance plays an important part in many dishes.

senses.definition: a tree on which yuzus grow

examples.x: I'm still trying to find a yuzu tree for our conservatory.
